website_summaries.verdict: A solid choice for hikers who prefer breathable material, ankle support, and comfort, but don't mind that the materials aren't completely waterproof.
pros: This pair generates enthusiasm for the comfortable fit that is perfect for most the first time on the foot without a break-in period
Radiant sole makes these boots ideal for hiking
Breathable mesh panels make them ideal for hiking in warmer climates
cons: Though water-resistant, the material isn't totally waterproof
Sizes may run just slightly large for some

customer_reviews.title: Decent light boot
customer_reviews.text: Bit expensive, however that's the price of avoiding made in china, and the quality is easily better than most china made goods(take constant supervision by the product contractor to ensure that the chinese are adhering to quality standards and specifications, many companies ignore this, e.g. Vasque apparently). Don't seem to be superwide to me, and previously ASOLO used to run on the narrower side, which is nice as I tend to wear an A or B width dependent upon mfg, etc. Much happier with the quality of these(few days) than a pair of Vasque Breezes (made in china) that I ordered a few years ago, as these don't leak through the sole, and are made to labelled size/width.
customer_reviews.author: cutterjohn

customer_reviews.title: Very nice boots
customer_reviews.text: Very nice boots. I own a pair of Salomon GTX Mids as well and while they are a bit more comfortable, I suspect these will be the same once they are broken in. They appear very well made. I am not a boot expert but I suspect these are a bit stiffer to support heavier loads during hiking or rucking. I said somewhat large on the size as they were a little roomier in the width than I expect for a 9 M.
customer_reviews.author: Dandy Tomczyk

customer_reviews.title: Easy to lace up with only 2 hooks at top
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and solid construction. Fit is slightly smaller than other Asolo boots of same size. All fabric, no leather. Laces high quality. Easy to lace up with only 2 hooks at top. Gortex is VERY water resistant, but not waterproof. I was dry for 2 hours of heavy downpour and tramping through puddles. No visible signs of wear over the first 100 miles.
customer_reviews.author: WARD

customer_reviews.title: First usages great
customer_reviews.text: I buy hiking boots 1/2 size larger than dress shoes or sneakers and these boots fit fine. They needed no breaking-in, give good support and seem very durable and waterproof. Because of inclement weather, the longest day hike has been around seven miles. These are comfortable and hope to use them for many years.
customer_reviews.author: S. S. Felzenberg

customer_reviews.title: Besides this issue these boots are awesome. They are very well made and feel very ...
customer_reviews.text: These boots fit my feet a little bit narrow so I ordered a 10.5 instead of the original 10 I had. They are still a tiny bit narrow but my as enough to return. Besides this issue these boots are awesome. They are very well made and feel very study and supportive, but are lightly and require very little break in. I've worn them for about a month now and like them a lot. Worth a try if you want something besides a leather hiking boot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Boot
customer_reviews.text: My second pair of Asolo's. Excellent boot for my foot and worth the money. My previous pair were a light duty trail boot that are just now falling apart - they are 10 years old and have been worn almost constantly. I tried the Vasque St. Elias and the Keen Durand, both 100 cheaper than the Asolo, but the Vasque hobbled me due to a hot spot on the outside right toe, and the Keens were too big in the toe box and heel. Every foot is different, but for me, the Asolo is the boot.
customer_reviews.author: wc sehlmeyer

customer_reviews.title: These will last for years
customer_reviews.text: Great boots, Ive been weating the same pair for 3 years now all over the world. This is my 2nd pair of Asolo Boots. My first pair lasted 5 years before they were unrepairable. I highly recommend a pair
customer_reviews.author: Jason Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Love em
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quick, very pleased, very good looking boot. Ex military so have worn Lowas, Bates, Altamas, still have Danners, Vasques, Salomons but I am very pleased and impressed with the quality of Asolos. Would recommend. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best pair of boots I have owned.
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots! I originally purchased them for an adventure vacation to Iceland and am so glad I did. They kept my feet nice and warm in freezing weather but breath so well I can use them all day at home with weather in the 70's and still be comfortable. Their build quality is top notch. I have put well over 150 miles on them and are holding up great. Considering the terrain lesser boots would be in stitches by now. I did have some initial concerns since the lace buckles I believe are plastic, but my concern seems unfounded as they have held up superbly. Fit seems true, if a little narrow but very comfortable to my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Michael SF

customer_reviews.title: Company is good to do business with however Asolo went way down hill
customer_reviews.text: company is GReAT to do business with, however trying to get asolo to warranty there defective products is not pleasent. Asolo quality is not near as good as it used to be,
customer_reviews.author: matt scott

customer_reviews.title: My 3rd pair over the past 8 yearts and they ...
customer_reviews.text: My 3rd pair over the past 8 yearts and they are worn almost every day for at least 4 miles of hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Allen E Lavelle

customer_reviews.title: These are great boots. I use them for work and it's ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots. I use them for work and it's usually 12 hour days! Went to REI to figure out my size then purchased off of amazon.
customer_reviews.author: daring4

customer_reviews.title: ASOLO DRIFTER GV BOOT
customer_reviews.text: Sweet boot looking boot Asolo Drifter Gv boot. BUT ONLY lasted 4 months. 180.00 for a 4 month hiking boot. Stitching falls apart. This boot should be priced at 50.00 free shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Jacko

customer_reviews.title: It's hard to believe.
customer_reviews.text: After one hike, a piece of the boot already came apart. It seems like that part of the boot is cheaply made. If that happened after one hike I can't imagine what would happen after one year. I bought these after having the Fugitives for 6 years with high expectations. Maybe I got a defective pair or a knockoff. It's hard to believe. I better get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Stern

customer_reviews.title: Really good boot, but durability is an issue
customer_reviews.text: I've bought two pairs of these boots over the years. The first pair lasted me years upon years. I loved them. So when they finally wore out, I just bought another pair. Unfortunately, the new pair has not lasted very long. The seams started to fall apart very early and the toe guard also started to peel off (same as photos shared by others). I was really surprised and disappointed that they only lasted a couple of months for such an expensive pair of boots. The first pair was so great and durable so not sure what happened (did they start skimping on the manufacturing quality?) to the second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Jamil

customer_reviews.title: Great boot. Scratch that. Fantastic boot.
customer_reviews.text: I have had these boots through the mountains of Afghanistan to the gumbo mud of Texas for the past three years. I am sad to say they finally are starting to tear. Seriously impressed with these. Trying out a different pair of Asolo. The gortex is still intact. I recommend them to everyone and anyone looking for a great boot. I use these for work in the plumbing industry. Lots of digging the last three years.
customer_reviews.author: BookReviewer

product_meta.title: Asolo Drifter Gv Boot - Men's
product_meta.description: Throw on a new pair of Asolo Men's Brown Drifter Gore-Tex Hiking Boots A23010 257 and enjoy unsurpassed comfort as you head out for a day on the trails. Here at Working Person� s Store, we understand people who work hard also like to play hard which is why we carry a selection of hardworking hiking boots. Designed for those who love mountain trails, Asolo Men's Brown Drifter Gore-Tex Hiking Boots A23010 257 offer hikers superior fit and performance. Whether you� re trekking through rivers, steep valleys or atop mountain peaks, these alpine boots are created with the latest innovative technology. The upper portion of the boot is constructed of a water-resistant suede and high tenacity nylon. Inside the hiking boots, you will find they are enhanced with Gor-Tex performance comfort lining. This combination of design and material ensures the boots are waterproof and breathable to protect your feet from moisture. For hiking purposes, these Asolo Men's Brown Drifter Gore-Tex Hiking Boots A23010 257 boots are made with Asoflex 00 SR board lasting, which means there is a solid fiber board that runs from the heel of the boot to the forefoot providing superior stability. The footbed is constructed of a lite 2 and the sole is made of Asolo / Vibram radiant rubber EVA. The outsole offers outstanding performance grip when trekking across most any object. The aggressive heel cleats and Aso-brake system help hikers enhance their grip on steep declines. The design of the forefoot provides increased support and control of pronation (ankle movement), while the molded EVA midsole ensures a high level of foot control and comfort. The combination of technology found in the Asolo Men's Brown Drifter Gore-Tex Hiking Boots A23010 257 delivers outstanding shock absorption, stability and precision in every step. Don� t wait. For the best price and selection, order a pair of Asolo Men's Brown Drifter Gore-Tex Hiking Boots A23010 257 from Working Person� s Store today! Sizes Manufactured: M 7-
